A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
This movie will be used in cinema schools as an example of what NOT to do with a movie which is a part of a saga. You simply can't ignore the previous behavior and features of the characters and just build your own personal version of them. You can't ignore the laws of the universe in which they live. You can't ignore the pace and tone of the previous installments.
It will also be used as an example of what happens when an amateur director (like Rian Johnson certainly is\, given his 2-only-movies resumè) is given complete control over the production. 
Finally it will be used as an example of what NOT to do after the movie is out and gets completely thrashed by the audience. You can't tell 53% of the audience that they are stupid for not liking your movie.
You are the stupid\, Rian.
